item.title: Report: Central Bankers Moving to Ban Cash
item.description:
Report: Central Bankers Moving to Ban Cash

The European Central Bank will stop printing the 500-Euro note, which economists have indicated is a step towards banning cash altogether. Claiming the banknote "could facilitate illicit activities," the ECB said it would stop producing the bill at the end of 2018, but academics are pointing out there's no evidence the bills were heavily used in crime.

item.title: Lawsuit challenging Facebook's facial recognition system moves forward
item.description:
Lawsuit challenging Facebook's facial recognition system moves forward

A lawsuit alleging that Facebook photo tagging violates user privacy has cleared a crucial early hurdle. A judge in Northern California District Court today ruled against a motion by Facebook to dismiss. That leaves the larger questions around biometric privacy unanswered, but clears the way for a major legal battle over one of Facebook's most popular products.

item.title: To the next POTUS: For communities of color, encryption is a civil right
item.description:
To the next POTUS: For communities of color, encryption is a civil right

From San Bernardino to Brooklyn to Capitol Hill, the fight over encryption has boiled over this past month. But who's paying attention? The basic security feature all of us depend on daily to protect our online payment transactions, message content, and other personal data is increasingly taken for granted.

item.title: Netflix Just Made It Way Easier To Stream Shows On the Go
item.description:
Netflix Just Made It Way Easier To Stream Shows On the Go

Streaming Netflix over a cellular connection has always felt like a sketchy proposition. You know you're burning data, but you just have to watch one more Kimmy Schmidt. Well, Netflix just rolled out a feature that means you may have to worry less.

item.title: Google Patents Device You Inject Into Your Eyeball
item.description:
Google Patents Device You Inject Into Your Eyeball

Forget laser surgery. If Google has a say in it, we'll soon be injecting devices into our eyes to help improve our vision. Andrew Hoyle | CNET - Up next in "terrifying things I don't ever want to have done": Google has filed a patent for a vision-correcting electronic device that has to be injected directly into your eye.

item.title: Beyonce: 'Lemonade' Album Stream & Download Link!
item.description:
Beyonce: 'Lemonade' Album Stream & Download Link!

Beyonce 's new album Lemonade is now available to stream on Tidal! The full twelve-track album was released near the end of the HBO special and it features full versions of many of the songs featured in the long video. There are both explicit and clean versions of the album.

item.title: Singer Prince dies suddenly at 57 - BBC News
item.description:
Singer Prince dies suddenly at 57 - BBC News

Singer Prince has died at his Paisley Park estate in Minnesota at the age of 57, his publicist tells AP. Police were called to a medical emergency at his estate earlier on Thursday, US media reported. Prince became a global superstar in the 1980s, with albums such as 1999, Purple Rain and Sign O' the Times.

item.title: London Is Getting Its First Naked Restaurant And There Are Already 8,000 People On The Waiting List
item.description:
London Is Getting Its First Naked Restaurant And There Are Already 8,000 People On The Waiting List

How many times have you sat down for dinner and thought, Boy, this meal would be so much better if everyone was naked? No? Come on, just think about the benefits: You don't have to worry about spilling food on your clothes. Or whether you're over- or underdressed for the meal.
